nodes.bodyText:
"the value" is too broad. Everything's a value. Can we be more specific?
Can we do something like this?
The first fact is the return value of the first group key mapping function, applied on the incoming tuple.
The second fact is the result value of ...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -209,19 +209,36 @@ */ UniConstraintStream groupBy(BiFunction groupKeyMapping); - /* - // TODO implement this + /** + * Convert the {@link BiConstraintStream} to a different {@link BiConstraintStream}, consisting of unique tuples. + *

+ * The first fact is the value resulting from applying the group key mapping function on the original tuple. + * The second fact is the value of applying a given {@link BiConstraintCollector} on all the tuples with the same

nodes.bodyText: If Drools supports these, don't we want to put the UnsupportedOperationException throwing in the Bavet impl?
Not sure what you mean. It is in Bavet impl.
nitpick code consistently: when optaplanner code captures the return value of map.put() or list.add(), it's typically called old*, not previous*. => Runnable oldUndo.

code style: map variable should end with Map.
containers -> containerMap
